revision.comment: /* Airports */ LYB is the one with unpaved runways
revision.text:
The '''transport infrastructure of the Cayman Islands''' consists of a public road network, two seaports, and three airports. ==Roads== As of 2000, the Cayman Islands had a total of 488 miles (785 km) of paved highway. Driving is on the left, and speed is reckoned in miles per hour, same as UK.https://www.sixt.co.uk/driving-tips/cayman-islands/ ==Seaports== Two ports, [[Cayman Brac]] and [[George Town, Cayman Islands|George Town]], serve the islands. One hundred and twenty-three ships (of 1,000 GT or more) are registered in the Cayman Islands, with a total capacity of 2,402,058 GT/{{DWT|3,792,094|metric|disp=long}}. Some foreign ships (including vessels from Cyprus, Denmark, Greece, Norway, the UK, and US) are registered in the Cayman Islands under a [[flag of convenience]]. (All figures are 2002 estimates.) ==Airports== There are three airports on the Islands, two with paved runways and one (on Little Cayman) with unpaved runways. ==Buses== A fleet of [[Share taxi]] minibuses serves Grand Cayman.{{cite web |url=http://caymanislandsyp.com/Island/Getting-Around/index-2.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-05-31 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120513071329/http://caymanislandsyp.com/Island/Getting-Around/index-2.php |archivedate=2012-05-13 }} A daily service starts at 6.00 from the depot and runs as follows from George Town to:{{cite web |url=http://www.grandcayman4u.com/transport/buses.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2013-10-05 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012073352/http://www.grandcayman4u.com/transport/buses.htm |archivedate=2013-10-12 }} **West Bay — every 15 minutes: 6.00–23.00 (24.00 on Fr, Sa). CI$1.50 each way. **Bodden Town — every 30 minutes: 6.00–23.00 (24.00 on Fr, Sa). CI$1.50 each way. **East End and North Side — every hour, 6.00–21.00 (24.00 on Fr). CI$2 each way. Colour-coded logos on the front and rear of the buses (white mini-vans) identify the routes: {| class="wikitable collapsible" ! colspan="3"|Bus routes travelling through George Town |- ! Line ! Route |- |
 Route 1 
| George Town to West Bay |- |
 Route 2 
| George Town to West Bay |- |
 Route 3 
| George Town depot to Bodden Town |- |
 Route 4 
| George Town depot to East End |- |
 Route 5 
| North Side to East End |- |
 Route 6 
| North Side to West Bay |- |
 Route 7 
| George Town inter-district service |- |
 Route 8 
| George Town depot to Hutland in North Side |- |
 Route 9 
| George Town through Frank Sound North Side |} == See also == * [[Cayman Islands]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{CIA World Factbook}} {{Americas topic|Transport in}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Transport In The Cayman Islands}} [[Category:Transport in the Cayman Islands| ]] {{Caymans-stub}}
